com.soa.message.handler
Class MessageFaultException

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Throwable
      java.lang.Exception
          com.soa.message.handler.MessageFaultException
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class MessageFaultException
extends java.lang.Exception

Exception to indicate a fault has been encountered that should be reported to the sender of a message. This interface is not specific to any particular binding. Sufficient detail should be placed in the exception so that a binding's fault reporting requirements can be met.

In somce cases faults may be also worthy of reporting to a management application. These cases are identified through the use of providing an additional error code and optional error context. This information can be used to generate events to the management application. It is often different than the fault information as the fault information may be less specific for security purposes.

Since:
5.0
See Also:

getProperties

public java.util.Map getProperties()
Returns a map of properties to be returned with the fault message. See Message.setProperties(java.util.Map). See MessageProperties for a list of some pre-defined message properties.

Returns:
Map of properties to associate with the fault message.

setProperties

public void setProperties(java.util.Map properties)
Configures a map of properties to be returned with the fault message. See Message.setProperties(java.util.Map). See MessageProperties for a list of some pre-defined message properties.

Parameters:
properties - Map of properties to associate with the fault message.

getRawMessage

public javax.xml.transform.Source getRawMessage()
Returns a raw message that should be returned to the client. This message will be returned instead of constructing one from a fault code and message text. It is assumed that the raw message is in it's bound (binding specific) format such as SOAP.

Returns:
Raw fault message content to be returned to the client in its bound format.

setRawMessage

public void setRawMessage(javax.xml.transform.Source msg)
Configures a raw message to return to the client. This message will be returned instead of constructing one from a fault code and message text. It is assumed that the raw message is in it's bound (binding specific) format such as SOAP. Therefore, when using this method one must be sure of the binding context they are in.

Parameters:
msg - Raw fault message content to be returned to the client in its bound format.

setError

public void setError(ErrorCode errorCode,
                     java.lang.Object[] errorContext)
Provides error information that may be reported to a management application in relation to the generated fault.

Parameters:
errorCode - ErrorCode identifying the error.
errorContext - Object[] holding error context objects, null if no context available.

getErrorCode

public ErrorCode getErrorCode()
Returns the error code associated with the fault (if any).

Returns:
ErrorCode associated with the fault, null if none reported.

getErrorContext

public java.lang.Object[] getErrorContext()
Returns the context for the error associated with the fault (if any).

Returns:
Object[] holding error context objects, null if no context available.
